src_texts: Five Star Stay ---SEP--- We were visiting the Bodleian Library, Divinity School, Ashmolean Museum and the Talking Maps exhibition at the Weston and chose this hotel as it had a great location, good reviews and on-site parking. Our room (41 ) overlooking the High Street and the beautiful Saint Mary The Virgin church was small-ish but very comfortable with a great bathroom. The service at The Old Bank is exceptional as is their wonderful restaurant, Quod. The Library Reading room was the perfect place for post-supper Sunday papers, drinks and catching up on e mails. The hotel Wi fi was excellent. I was delighted to find that the Real Tennis Court at Merton College, where I had a Sunday evening match, was only one minute away and whilst I played my wife enjoyed an ad lib Evensong at the nearby college Chapel. We then adjourned to the nearby Kings Arms pub for a pint in one of their back room snugs complete with open coal fire. Well worth the trip. I later found out that a good friend of ours had had a beer in that room during his Oxford Uni days with W H Auden! The hotel is central for everything and so our car stayed in the car park throughout our stay and the hotel very kindly allowed us an extra couple of hours parking whilst we completed our Oxford tour on the Monday lunchtime. We will be returning to Oxford again later this year and will most definitely be staying at The Old Bank Hotel. Five Stars minimum.

Once again, thank you for your very nice review and we are looking forward to welcoming you again very soon. Kind regards, Pablo Garcia Front Office Manager

src_texts: Haven away from Waikiki ---SEP--- After a few days in Waikiki Hilton Village we decided to split our short stay in Oahu with a trip out here for 3 days. Caught a fixed price Charleys taxi to the hotel . What a chilled resort! Loved it. Room was a studio with a king and sofa bed, was tiny and very dark but with 3 pools to choose from and the beach with comp sun beds I didn't care! There is an escape from the little kids in the hot tubs, the middle pool is called the reflection pool and the hot tub is kids free! Another tip is to buy food from the Island Store at Ko olina station ( Monkeypod kitchen and other restaurants here too), much cheaper than the resort which was $10.75 for a turkey sandwich and $8 hotdogs , the other store does salads and hot meals for takeaway corn dogs $1.70 chicken and rice $6. Ate at Longboards and Chucks, was pleasantly surprised at Chucks to have a great steak. The resort is full of good service and everyone is in on "Aloha" , felt like Hawaii as opposed to Waikiki. We hired a car from the desk in the hotel, good rates and super simple. Would definitely recommend to all.

src_texts: Just ok ---SEP--- The owners were friendly and helpful with providing information during my stay. The room was clean and had pretty good furnishings including a fridge. Still, the furnishings are very basic. The room was freezing when I arrived (during December) because the thermostat was turned down. I understand that it's expensive to heat these rooms and that it's wasteful to do so when they are empty but it did take a long time to warm up. Also, the stairs to the second floor are made of sheet metal and the reverberations through the building are extremely loud whenever someone walks on them: prepare to be woken up if someone is going up the stairs while you're sleeping. The wireless internet connection from my room was ok but YMMV.
ref_texts: Hello Eliot P, Thank you for taking your time to write a review. You're more than 100% right, turning heat up in winter does become costly. I do recommend all guest to call at least 3 to 4 hours ahead to notify they are arriving to this destination or any other accommodation places, this way we can do everything ahead of time to make your stay pleasant and comfortable. Regarding the metal stairs, this was the first time someone has brought it up to me. I will definitely look into it, and yes i have fixed the internet signal, much better than before. Again, internet is complimentary given to guest who stays here. Again i would like to thank you for staying with us and hope to see you in future. Take care

src_texts: Nice rooms with a few minor issues. ---SEP--- Our short overnight stay was ok but a few issues would have frustrated me if we had been there longer. The rooms are spacious and have good amenities so very comfortable for a family but using the two rooms means one bed is right next to an emergency exit sign and sensor light which was on all night and resulted in no sleep! Also in the smaller shower the oversized rain shower-head caused flooding and the only other option was a handheld shower at waist height. Beware we were almost stung with a surprise $50 charge for a rollaway on check-in! Car-parking is secure, spacious and easy to access. If you can get over the little niggles the hotel is in a great central location, neat, tidy and with polite and helpful staff.

src_texts: 5 day break with Shearings ---SEP--- What can I say that hasn't already been said, I haven't got one complaint, from the journey down to Corley exchange and on to the Berresford with two breaks was good, the hotel excellent, very friendly staff, and the thing I liked was that you were given a table in the dining room and that was yours all week , a table for 2 so you didn't share a table with strangers. Food excellent, full English breakfast and help yourself, Dinner 3 courses and 3/4 choices . Lovely room , the heating was on when we arrived and we could control it , only had it on in the afternoon, the room was at the rear of the hotel but a nice view, top marks for bathroom big walk in shower , spotless, clean white sheets on bed . And as if that was not enough, 4 free drinks each every day. Top marks , keep up the good work .

src_texts: Excellent stay - all aspects covered and no bad points ---SEP--- This was my second stay. This time I upgraded to a junior suite. Some of the standard rooms are tiny and I enjoyed the extra space which I thought was worth the extra money. The staff were efficient and friendly. I managed to get a very early check-in (7am) at no extra cost although I guess that's just luck. The location is brilliant and the hotel restaurant is excellent - much better than most hotels, the breakfasts are superb. No complaints.

src_texts: Such a shame... ---SEP--- Having always wanted to stay at The Balmoral we resulted in having a great excuse when friends invited us to their wedding here. We booked a standard room and greatly looked forward to our special treat. We booked into the room and our initial thoughts were sadly a tired room. It was clean but clearly well worn. We had a fabulous time at the wedding and fell into bed exhausted. Bed and linen fantastic. When we showered, brushed our teeth and hubby shaved we had dirty water in both sink and bath which you had to stand in collecting as it wouldn't drain away. When we had breakfast which was good and checked out my hubby mentioned this but the happy couple appeared so we took it no further. I then wrote to The Balmoral, who promptly responded apologising, explaining they are upgrading rooms and offered us an upgrade the next time we stay. Having no reason to stay as we live locally that's unlikely to happen. A very disappointing reaction to what they clearly knew was the case with this room as there was no surprise or need for investigation.

src_texts: Pleasant stay, but certainly not as good as previously ---SEP--- The last time I stayed in the Hudson Bay was about 10 years ago, soon after it opened. Was really impressed with it at the time. This occasion was a family wedding. I ate in the bar, at the wedding, and again at breakfast the next morning. The food was alright, but certainly nothing to write home about. But the hotel itself, I felt, had really gone down, there were some renovations going on - so once you got out of the lift, the place looked a bit dishevelled. And a lot of noise throughout the night from conversations from other visitors - management take note, if refurbishing, some better soundproofing would be in order. Also at breakfast the next morning, the doors and windows looked grubby. However, what saves this hotel is that the staff who were really attentive and pleasant - well done on that.
ref_texts: Thank you for your valued feedback on Trip Advisor. I would like to apologise profusely for any inconvenience caused by our recent renovations but as you can appreciate these are necessary to improve and maintain the hotel. We are constantly looking at ways to improve our food menus and I passed on your comments to our Executive Head Chef, Mr Rory Gabriel. He would like to apologise profusely for any anxiety caused and he assures me that this will be looked at and improved on. On a positive note, I was delighted to hear that you found our staff to be attentive and pleasant and I will pass on your kind words at our next Management meeting. I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your valued and repeat business. We would not be happy to allow our guests to leave the hotel with a negative impression. We would be honored if you would return to the hotel in the near future and afford us the opportunity to make amends. If you do decide to return, please do not hesitate to contact myself or my PA and we can make the necessary arrangements for you and perhaps offer you some form of recompense as a gesture of goodwill. Yours sincerely, Timothy Hayes

src_texts: Wonderful rooms and GREAT staff ---SEP--- Many other reviews and photos capture the unique historical beauty of this historic property, so I want to comment on the extraordinary attention from members of the staff. Upon arrival my wife and I were assigned to a second floor room in the courtyard. Due to her childhood polio, this proved challenging and the reservation manager immediately and without specific request shifted us to a room on the main level closer to the main rooms. After dinner, he noticed that she was tired and immediately volunteered to drive us with his personal car to our room, thus avoiding the interior staircase in the main building. We simply won't forget his kindness, and this level of caring was evident in other staff members. Simply, you can have a great property, but it can never be as meaningful if it does not have extraordinary people dedicated to the highest level of service. This is truly a special place to visit.

src_texts: A good deal ---SEP--- Was here for a two night stay that was a mixture of business and sightseeing. The rate per night was excellent, the rooms were typically solid Marriott rooms. Hotel contains a swimming pool, outside firepit and sitting area, ok workout facility for basic stuff, and plenty of parking. It is reasonably close to the airport, right by highway which gets you to downtown Charlotte within 7-8 minutes, so it was in an extremely convenient location. The staff, well I did not have to rely on them too much, but in my few dealings with them they seemed more interested in eating pizza, drinking coffee, or talking to their boyfriends. They do not seem like the most energetic bunch of workers nor did they possess particularly bubbly personalities, but still handled the few basic things in an acceptable manner. There is a bar and restaurant, but I did not eat there. I went to get a basic breakfast biscuit and the price for the sausage and egg biscuit by itself was 10 dollars-ridiculous. I understand that you pay more in retaurant hotels, but this was not even a sit down meal. There are enough other eating options in the area that are reasonably priced and probably better quality food so this was not a big deal for me. I would stay here again only if the rates were still reasonable. I definitely would not pay more than 120 per night for this hotel, but at that rate or less should be considered a bargain.
ref_texts: Thank you for posting your feedback about our property on Tripadvisor. I appreciate all the feedback received as it allows me to gauge how we are being perceived. I am very proud of the property, we have a lot of great amenities and location. Focusing the team on delivering outstanding guest service consistently is a main priority and we are working to improve. We do offer a value for the traveler who wants to stay near Uptown without the Uptown prices. We are 6 blocks from the ligh trail and will gladly shuttle guests to/from the airport and light rail. Our restaurant concept the Bistro is available for breakfast, dinner and bar service in the evenings. We offer a quick casual menu with many healthy options and we brew Starbucks specialty beverages including Lattes and Expresso's. We will review our pricing model to ensure we are priced appropriately. src_texts: Great location but poor value ---SEP--- Tiny rooms, 10 pounds extortion fee to use Internet (with ridiculously complex username/PW sign-in process), cold staff. ref_texts: Dear jim4429, Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts of your recent stay at the Europa Hotel. I am very disappointed to hear that your stay did not live up to your expectations. I apologise you felt your room was not up to standard however the bedroom type you chose was one of our classic bedrooms which was part of the original Hotel built over 40 years ago. src_texts: great hotel - but not cheap ---SEP--- We arrived tired and jet lagged in the early hours of the morning and our room (understandably) wasnt ready - but were welcomed by the manager (a 'celeb' was on the same flight/in same hotel as us - I cant imagine he would normally do that - but it was nice) but they treated us to a complimentary breakfast and we watched the sun rise over sydney opera house from the comfort of our breakfast table. The location and the view is amazing. We went out for a walk and they phoned us a couple of hours later to say our room was ready - having fast tracked house keeping when the previous guest had checked out. The room was well appointed and comfortable - worth paying the extra for a harbour view. The concierge staff were helpful and attentive and sorted things out when our pre-booked trip to the Blue Mountains failed to show up - they made them come back and fetch us :-) They booked us fab trips and made great eating out recommendations. Customer service at reception and breakfast were first rate. Laundry service excellent but a little pricey. Overall a wonderful start to our grand tour of Australia. We went a few years before the date indicated - but it wont let you "back review" and ive only just got properly into trip advisor - which is a great website.
ref_texts: Thank you to the author for your review of Park Hyatt Sydney. I am very glad to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and found the service to be first rate. I am glad that you were taken good care of when your room was not ready for your early arrival. We certainly do all possible to have your room ready when you arrive, however, in the few instances where it is not, we can generally put it on priority and have it ready in a short period of time. My Concierge certainly works hard to ensure we offer the best possible options and service to our guests so I am pleased to read that he was able to get you on your tour. I will be sure to share your review with him and commend him for his work. I certainly hope that this recent stay was as good, if not better, than your first stay and I also hope to welcome you back to Park Hyatt Sydney in the near future. Regards, Leigh Shepheard Front Office Manager.

src_texts: Ask for a top floor room ---SEP--- The hotel was comfortable, but on the floor above us was a young family. Luckily, my wife slept through it, but it could have been different if she had been woken up. On a positive note, the breakfast was excellent, and we didn't have to wait for the shower to warm up in the morning.

src_texts: Excellent point of arrival/departure for UK business trips ---SEP--- Excellent hotel for London visits as well as focal point for departures/arrivals into the Uk. My business trips to the Uk (Bristol) require an early morning departure/arrival at LHR, the Renaissance provides a great place to align with the time zone, and get ready for business or, as experienced recently, come back home. Joel Romero at the front desk exemplifies what I we expect from a Marriott hotel, great service and special treatment to Platinum members. Everything from check-in/out, special requests (local transportation, etc) always provided with a smile and a "can do" attitude. The remodel performed last couple of years of the rooms/facilities is very tasteful and elegant. This has become our favorite Marriott chain hotel in the UK! Thanks Renaissance, keep up the good work!...see you soon.

src_texts: Night before Thanksgiving, good with some disappointments ---SEP--- Beautiful hotel about 10-15 min walk to Amalie Center. Check in very quick, lady was very kind (sorry I didn’t catch name since it was loud in the lobby). Room clean but small. Booked the Pure Allergy room, was able to check in online and select on the executive lounge level 17th floor with double beds. Beds are pretty small, I kept rolling into my husband and we are both small people. Also, no HEPA filter in room but they did remove feather products. We use Clorox wipes whenever we arrive and the room was well dusted, so kudos to housekeeping. Received 2 comp appetizers with our room since none served in exec lounge which only had fruit, trail mix, juices, water, teas and coffees. Had to use downstairs at 211 where food was good (communication was a bit lacking since I called down to ask where apps would be served and I was told “in the lounge” so we waited a few minutes in the exec lounge but had to call again to find out it’s the lounge downstairs). However, server seemed a bit irritated and short although she still did a good job. Not sure if it was because we had the free apps but we did buy extra food for our kids and gave her a good tip. Anyway, exec lounge closed for Thanksgiving so no breakfast or snacks for us. Wish we would have known the night before since I would have stocked up on water, a couple of juices and some fruit. Also, no free breakfast with Honors Gold unlike Hilton Time Square and Beverly Hills. We use a noise maker when we sleep so sound was not an issue. But when I got up in the morning while family was still asleep I can hear noises next door and in the hallway. Overall decent, nice stay for a night after a hockey game. Next time will try MARRIOTT or Embassy Suites which is right next door to Amalie Arena and breakfast will be for sure.

src_texts: Never fails to exceed expectations ---SEP--- We have stayed several times now at the hotel and in the Headland Cottages, there is a reason we keep coming back for 'storm watchers' 'short breaks' 'recharging' - it never fails to delight 'We' have expanded over the years from two of us plus a dog enjoying excellent coastal walks, roaring log fires, delicious food and wine and indulging in fantastic views from our excellent hotel rooms to.... well.....Us and friends, a geriatric dog, a 7 year old and a 1 year old and staying in the self catering cottages and STILL it has somehow managed to be a relaxing experience, no mean feat with our group! The cottages are excellent for our family needs, so well equipped, stunningly located, a real indulgent home from home. Our daughter was beside herself with excitement and our son had the best time charging round exploring. As ever the service in the hotel was outstanding, the food was gorgeous and being able to relax with the kids (yes they did make it possible) was just brilliant. src_texts: A beautiful resort atmosphere ---SEP--- This resort sits in the community of ko olina a golf and beach vacation area on the west side of Oahu. It's huge and self contained and not at all like the touristy areas of Waikiki and Ala Moana. There are lots of area here for the young, the teens and the aged to enjoy even the folks in wheelchairs. There must be like 3 to 4 areas for swimming as well as a lagoon just for hotel guests... but outside of the hotel boundaries are even more lagoons and pathways to the other hotel properties in ko olina. Overall a gorgeous, huge, self contained beach property to explore and enjoy

src_texts: Sloppy ---SEP--- Was given an apartment away from the Hotel although asked for a room. Crazy lighting system all over the place took ages to find all the switches all I wanted was a reading light for the bed. Incessant beeping noise found out it was a dish washer. People next door sounded like they were in the same apartment as me poor sound proofing. Overcharged on leaving which is OK mistakes happen but the duty desk person definitely made me feel I had had the meal which as the waiter later confirmed was a large family. Was over charged on the mini bar. Again fairly common mistakes but in total the experience was sloppy and the reaction to my pointing out a mistake was judgemental and almost hostile, the tut and rolled up eyes didnt go down well. Sorry guys you just had yours eyes off the ball this time and you could lose the attitude as well, next time will do cheap and cheerful. :(
ref_texts: Thank you for your feedback Marius. I am disappointed to see any negative review of course, especially where the approachability and guest interactions are concerned. I have spoken with the team regarding our delivery and stressed the importance of dealing with these small issues in a more professional manner. Our Lakefront Apartment suites are exactly as described, approximately 75 meters away from the main hotel building and I am confident this was explained on the phone at the time of reservation as the request was for our sister property which was fully booked. We do set the dishwashers to run during the day so we can empty when the cycle finishes and usually check again at turndown, I have asked the housekeeping manager to confirm with her team the procedures so the 'Cycle Finish' alarm doesn't reoccur later in the evening, I can understand that would be an unwelcome intrusion! We appreciate feedback on all aspects of the operation, particularly on any interaction issues as this is one of our primary areas of focus - getting the guest experience just right. I certainly apologise if the face to face service you encountered did not live up to our standards - rest assured it is dealt with at the hotel. Kind regards, James Cavanagh

src_texts: Only if you don't have any other choice ---SEP--- This was a last minute booking for us by someone else, and we would have done better to pay more attention to other reviews before confirming. First things first, if you want to be near the beach at Manly this place is well located as it's only one street back (but see my comment below about the road). Now for the rest: it's apparently managed by the Backpacker Hostel round the corner, and the backpacker mentality is apparent in the way it's managed and fitted out. On arrival you have to leave a $30 deposit for the keys, fair enough, but instead of taking an imprint of your credit card and then cancelling it (like 99% of other places do) they actually deduct the money and then refund it afterwards. If you're from overseas this means you pay two bank transactions, each with fees. When we pointed this out we were told "I don't know the difference [between cancelling and refunding]". Well I'm afraid in this line of work you should know the difference! There are then about 35 steps to get to the apartments (no lift), which can be difficult with heavy/voluminous luggage. The kitchen is decorated with signs telling you you'll have to pay a $2000 fire brigade call out fee if you burn the toast (see what I mean about backpacker mentality?). The room we were in faced out onto the main road, as there is no double glazing or sound insulation of any sort it was very noisy, especially in the morning. The bathroom door was on a noisy sliding runner, impossible to go to the toilet in the middle of the night without waking your partner. Wifi was not free (seriously in this day and age?); it was the only place we stayed in during a month's travels in Australia where we would have had to pay, however at the backpacker hostel round the corner they at least had 30 minutes free (according to the sign plastered on the front of that building). If you're looking for accommodation that's only one step up from a hostel this is for you, otherwise avoid.
ref_texts: Hey there, Thank you for your review. As a budget hotel our aim is to provide clean, comfortable accommodation at the best price in Manly. We do charge a key deposit as provide guests with a physical key not a swipe card, the deposit reminded people to return the key at the end of the stay. However, I can understand your frustration with international bank charges and will look into the alternative of holding the charge on the card. We do also accept cash, which obviously would not have incurred any extra charges for you. Manly Beachside Apartments and Manly Backpackers are owned by the same company, we do have a reception at the Beachside Apartments which is open from 2pm - 5pm Monday to Saturday, if you check in outside of these times we do ask guests to check in at the hostel, which is just across the road, this is the only point where the two business cross paths as they are run independetly of each other. All of the rooms are on the first floor and accessed by the main staircase, if you do have lots of bags our staff are always happy to help in any way they can. We do charge $3 a day for unlimited internet, as a budget hotel we are able to offer low prices by ensuring guests are not paying for anything they don't intend to use. I hope you enjoyed the rest of your travels in Australia. All the best, Manly Beachside Apartments

ref_texts: Thank you DrillerQueen, I do apologise for the smell you experienced during your stay. Back during your stay, we had just come out of numerous days of continuous rain, and this plays havoc with various smells coming from gardens and the adjacent river. Luckily this kind of rain pattern is not that frequent, and it is safe to say the smell you experienced is long gone along with the cyclonic weather that brought it. Don't give up on travelling to Noosa, even if you choose not stay at The Sebel for your next visit. Tourism Noosa promotes we have 300 days of sunshine, and having lived here for 3 years now, I can say that is fairly close to the mark. While we may not be your first choice, there are some other great resorts in Noosa, and we would love to see you make the trip back again to our beautiful little corner of the country. Regards, Cameron (General Manager)

src_texts: park in North road, not Bathwick Hill ---SEP--- Firstly, satnav takes you up wrong driveway, so if you don't see the YHA sign in Bathwick Hill, you're going uphill for quite a long way, , to a dead-end. Not so good when you're walking. There are parking restrictions on Bathwick Hill, so as a previous writer says, park in North Road, and you have a shorter walk down into the property rather than the uphill one from main road. When walking into the City (or taking the frequently (especially university term time) passing buses, use Bathwick Hill. Set in wonderful position, and recently refurbished to high standard in the newly built outbuildings,, plus the main house is pretty gorgeous with good community and facilities

src_texts: Great Location ---SEP--- We stayed at this hotel this past weekend for the ND/Purdue football game. The stadium is only a few blocks away, well within walking distance. The quality and condition of the room was quite good and appeared to have been updated recently. Service from the front desk and the rest of the staff was very good, especially the maid and valet service. We had breakfast as part of our package, and the breakfast buffet contained a reasonable variety of offerings. We had cocktails in the roof top revolving lounge/restaurant and the view overlooking downtown Indianapolis was interesting. In all, we found nothing to complain about in this hotel and would certainly stay here again if we found ourselves in Indianapolis.

src_texts: Warm welcome ---SEP--- We stayed in Dublin for the 'Rock and Roll' half marathon weekend. We originally booked a standard room without breakfast, but were given the option to upgrade to the executive room. Glad we did, the room was large and spacious, nice comfortable king size bed, fridge (which was a godsend for keeping water cool for our races) large tv, bath (again a god send for after the races). There was a building site next to the hotel but it did not effect our stay. Received a warm welcome on arrival, used the executive lounge and would like to mention the staff in the lounge were excellent. They were friendly and nothing was too much trouble, in particular Bart on the Friday evening and, cant remember the young chaps name, but he worked on the Sunday evening. The hotel was centrally located and it was easy enough to get to the start line in plenty of time on the Saturday and Sunday. It is also a short walk into the main shopping area. The breakfast was a buffet style, lots of choice and again the staff were very attentive. Ate in the hotel bar on our last night and we both enjoyed the meal, also felt they were reasonably priced. Wifi was free through the hotel, and speed was good. Overall enjoyed our stay and next time we come back to Dublin we will be booking the Hilton again.

src_texts: Adequate for short stay ---SEP--- My fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights on a trip down the Great Ocean Road from Melbourne. It's a good base for exploring and a good location in town, with very short walks to the beach and into town where there are plenty of places for any meal. They also had a deal with some of the local restaurants for free glasses of wine which was a nice touch. We were in an apartment room which had a huge TV and all the cooking facilities you could want, however, you did get charged if you left any dirty dishes/didn't take our your rubbish which seemed a little odd (this didn't affect us though, as we were only there for 2 nights). The bed was very comfortable and we had a very good sleep, despite the light coming in from the path outside and the conversations we could hear through the wall. The only major down side was the shower, which was either scalding hot or freezing cold. When asked about this, the receptionist didn't offer much assistance, though we were told on departure that a plumber was coming to look at the issue. There were a few marks on walls and what not but generally clean and tidy. I wouldn't call it luxury, but very comfortable for a short stay.

src_texts: Understaffed? ---SEP--- The indoor hot tub had a lot of sand in it. The outdoor hot tubs were fine but there was never any towels available at the tubs. Our entrance light bulb was burned out, so our room was very dark. The breaker tripped on our first morning while I blow dried my hair, and we had to wait about 20 minutes for the maintenance person to fix it. Our room wasn't cleaned after our first day of skiing, but fresh towels were provided when I phoned the front desk. The shower curtain didn't close, so the floor and door were soaked(hence the rotten tiles in the bathroom). The Tonquin(Decore Hotels) needs some serious maintenance!

src_texts: great hosts and Lovely accommodation ---SEP--- We stayed at Park Dene for the New year weekend. On our arrival we was greeted by the owners Paul and Mags. We was given our parking permit and they offered us tea and coffee. We was shown to our room and what can I say the room was amazing. It was clean, warm and so comfy. Made you feel right at home! The breakfast was outstanding you had plenty to choose from and it definitely filled you up for your day ahead. The location on the B&B is a 10 minute walk from the centre. On New Years Eve Mags visited each guest room with a glass of bucks fizz or Prosecco, she definitely knew how to treat her guests. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here and we will be back again.
ref_texts: Happy new year once again and many thanks for taking the time to write such a lovely review. Both me and Paul are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to seeing you again when you next visit in April. Take care Mags & Paul

src_texts: Friendliest hotel in Charlotte! ---SEP--- I was in Charlotte for a conference and chose this hotel because it was an easy walking distance from the Convention Center. I am so happy with my choice. This is a great hotel, with clean, comfortable and spacious rooms, a great breakfast, and fast, efficient wifi. However, what raises this hotel from good to excellent is the quality of the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and really went above and beyond to ensure I had a good stay, despite some personal challenges (my luggage was delayed by two days!) I would not hesitate to stay here again.

src_texts: A good place to stay in Ft. Lauderdale ---SEP--- We stayed here after getting off a cruise ship, and were very surprised at what a perfect choice this was to stay in. It is located right near a lovely walking path along the beach, lined with shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is very plain wrap on the outside. But inside is very nice. There is a nice pool area. Rooms are modern, towels are great, staff is very nice, and the breakfast has many choices and has new things each morning and is served until 10:30am. It is close to the port and the airport.

src_texts: 1st Indy 500 trip ---SEP--- Brand new hotel! The smell says it all even being open for just 10 weeks it still has that "new hotel" smell to it! The rooms had really comfortable beds in them! The food in the restaurant is really tasty even thou they were run off there feet from all of the 500 goers they kept up to the demand! Teresa and Chelsea stood out the most as our waitress as well one was brand new (the first beer I have ever served) and the other one I hope I still get the bucket of beer! Thanks for the great time and service down there

src_texts: Disappointing in comparison to expectation. ---SEP--- Selected hotel for post cruise stay on recommendation of friends who have stayed many times and love it. Couldn't be more helpful and always a lovely smile for everyone. Only ate breakfast in Indigo as unable to accommodate us at our choice of time in the evening but service on day 3 was very poor with only waiter appearing to be on duty after he had waited until 11 for a table. His name was DJ and he was very good. Overall disappointed in comparison to our expectations which were maybe just too high.

The restaurant connected is tasty and eggs benny were on point according to friends. The hotel isn’t 5star but the hotel for the price is legit. Go eat at Gyu-Kaku and Duke’s, those were 2 of my faves!

src_texts: Good welcome and bedrooms but sloppy business services ---SEP--- In a good quiet location yet still right in the middle of the city. Typical (comfortable) bedrooms with good bed. Breakfast was very good with decent choice and a chef who came around to ask how breakfast was, shake my hand, and said he hoped I would have a good day at 7am! Never had this experience and it was nice. Check in was efficient and warm, with an interest in how my day/journey had been. The less than 5 star rating is more to do with poor attention when it came to the room we had booked for interviews the following day and the issue of parking. Firstly, we struggled to get the simple issue of a jug of water replenished, secondly a member of staff walked in right in the middle of an interview (!) and finally our validated ticket (to give us free parking in the nearby NCP in the absence of an hotel car park) had not been validated and we had to pay £15 to get out because we were in a hurry. So a good hotel overall but a bit sloppy with their business services.

src_texts: Enchanting ---SEP--- It was my first visit to Bath and i was so excited. I saw this hotel online and were only planned on staying one night for business so i booked a beautiful suite at this historic hotel and i wasn't disappointed at all. I fell in love instantly. I felt like i was in a story book. A four poster bed with all the trimmings! High and soft. Had a great nights sleep. Cleanliness was perfect. We woke up the next day and it had been snowing! Made for an even more magical experience. Pulling up out front it doesn't really look like a hotel so we were like....What?!...but ALL the staff were so welcoming....like we were arriving to their home. treated like rock stars. It was so quiet and peaceful. When we ate at the restaurant that evening for dinner we thought we were the only ones in this massive hotel but more guests arrived. The food was lovely for dinner. The waiters were personable as well. I loved breakfast the next day . They put together a wonderful array of foods. I didn't want to leave. One night is not enough but we were on business. Definitely going back again and staying longer. I fell in love with this place. The elevator was tiny but that made it even more quaint. I think only two people can fit in it hahaha. I loved it.

src_texts: Don't believe the hype! ---SEP--- Spent 5 nights here, on a 15k Points and 400 AUD Cash rate, booked before Hyatt changed the P&C system. If I had paid anything more than this, I would have checked out early... My review will be based on the fact that this hotel has a standard rate upwards of $850 per night. Which, to me, is incomprehensible... We arrived very early (7:30am) and of course, as expected, there was no room available, as the hotel was fully booked. After a nearly 24 hours of traveling, we wanted to refresh, so we were told that we could use the gym facilities to do so. The gym facilities are very small. 3 people barely fit in the room. There were no lockers to store anything while showering (they were all locked). Only one shower, with a small, used bottle of shampoo and no soap in it. We joked about this with a gentleman from Alabama while he waited for me to shower. "I'll save you some shampoo", I told him. Then we decided we wanted some breakfast. As a Globalist, breakfast is free, but not on the day of your arrival, we were told, so 65 AUD for breakfast. The breakfast spread was nice, but nothing to write home about, or pay for. We had breakfast on 2 of the 5 days we were there after that. Given that no room upgrade was available, maybe a nice customer service gesture would have been to treat us to breakfast on this first day? No... At around 11am we received a call that the room was ready, so we headed back to the hotel. Location wise, the hotel does not win any points. It's nice if you want to explore the Rocks area, but for the rest of the city it's a long walk to the nearest train or bus station - at least 15 minutes. Which brings me to the view... Yes, if you have a room with an Opera view, the view is nice. We did not get any Globalist upgrade, as the hotel was full, so we stayed in the booked Harbor View King. Room 128, on the first floor. The first impression of the room itself was nice, but nothing to write home about. Our view was of each and every cruise ship that docked in the harbor, and a bit of the city in the background. If I stepped out onto the balcony, and leaned over the edge, and looked left, yes, there was the Opera. But really? You can stay at the Four Seasons or the Shangri-La for half of the PH standard rate for a non-view room, and get their harbor view room, and have the entire harbor and Opera in your view... The best thing about the room was the Le Labo cosmetics. The bathroom was nice, but the shower pressure mediocre. And the TV in the room was placed too low across from the bed, it was difficult to watch without getting a neck ache. The room was clean, apart from a long black hair I noticed in the shower on our third day (neither of us has long black hair...). And the noise... Upon arrival, we felt like napping. I had to use the earplugs I got from the plane to get some sleep! The noise from the harbor, trucks backing up close by, and people shouting outside the hotel on the promenade, was too much. When we returned to the hotel on our first evening, at around 11:45pm, I requested a new pair of earplugs from the front office. I was told they were going to send it up to the room. 30 minutes later I got dressed again, walked back to the front desk, asked again, and this time I waited there until they brought them to me. Overall, I was not impressed by the service. All smiles, but... If I had booked a standard rate, I would have probably checked out after the second night, and relocated elsewhere. I am a very frequent traveler, Globalist with WoH, and I do stay at luxury hotels. The value for money that the Park Hyatt in Sydney provides is nowhere close to being good. I would not return. And I seriously don't understand the hype.

src_texts: Avoid this hotel even if free ---SEP--- Travel is my business. I can allow for many things that may go wrong during a hotel stay but I could never allow for a consistantly bad customer service. Our flight was delayed. We arrived to the hotel 24 hours later than usual due to a big snow storm that closed many airports .....Needless to say we could not wait to get into a warm shower and comfortable bed. We were told by a cold front desk employee that we have no reservations. We showed them the travel agents reservations and their response sorry your reservations were for last night and if you do not show up they are cancelled entirely. We were surprised and said we were booked for five days and we missed one day but we still have 4 more reserved and already paid for in advance. Sorry nothing we can do says the young cold girl at the front sesk. She offered no suggestions. I said what can we do.? Her answer we have the space book the rooms again. it was for almost 200 dollars a night. was willing to accept but I thought maybe the front desk manager would have some helpful ideas. Big mistake to have bothered the front desk manager. He was upset that we even bothered him offered nothing but cold and non helpfel comments. I feel that he cares about his hair and glasses a lot more than he cares about business. we ended up staying the night and we would never go back even if free. All the staff that we had encountered at the front desk were cold and impersonal. They looked to me like they were reading from a script. The rooms were ok but nothing special. The view was horrible and the windows were dirty and we found old socks in the corner of the room. I would have never got mad about the socks if the front desck staff had any warmth or hospitality training in them. I feel the problem is an attitude problem that stems from the top. Do yourselves a favour and get rid of the front desk staff from top to bottom. even the staff on day shift when we checked out were made with the same ingredients as those ones from the night before. How sad you can have a nice property if you teach the staff the value of ncustomer service. The rest of the staff in the bar and dining broom as well as the valet were more friendly but far from fine. I am mvery surprised that westin keeps its name on your property. you need a lot of training to get close to where you should be. Avoid this property and stay anywhere else in Halifax.

src_texts: A truly first-class hotel! ---SEP--- Having previously stayed at Hilton Melbourne South Wharf numerous times with my family - most recently December 2011 and then again January 2012 - in May I stayed there for a week with work. I was working at a conference taking place at the adjoining Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre. The hotel is ideally located for any event at the Convention Centre and it was great to be able to easily return to my room - as well as other hotel facilities - at any time during the conference. I arranged my stay via email earlier this year and, on my arrival, check-in was fast, I was given an upgrade for my week there, and was personally welcomed by the duty manager. And it was very easy to see that some things just don't change at this hotel - you always get fantastic service with a smile from all staff, top quality food, and the rooms and facilities are always looking first-class. Nothing is ever too much trouble. The person who oversees the Executive Lounge, who has been there since this quite new hotel opened and we have seen there every time we have stayed at this hotel, does a superb job - as do all the staff there. When you are away from home for a week, to be personally welcomed back is a great way to start your stay. The service and food in the Executive Lounge are always excellent. I often spent hours working in the Lounge as it is such a great, very spacious facility. Hilton Melbourne South Wharf is an exceptional hotel and, having stayed there many times since it opened, I can say it consistently offers the very best. The warm and friendly service from staff make staying there a real pleasure.

src_texts: Good for the price ---SEP--- My wife and I stayed at the Magnolia hotel for a one-night anniversary get-away. I chose the hotel primarily because of the price and a recommendation of a family member. We paid $202, which included tax, a $26 valet parking fee, and a $5 bottle of Voss water that we accidentally opened while in our room. Here's what I liked about the hotel: - Central location. - Convenient, reasonably-priced valet parking. - Free afternoon cocktails. - Price. Honestly, if you include the cost of valet parking, this is about as cheap at it gets for a decent hotel in this part of the city. I wasn't crazy about the room itself, though. We were on the 11th floor in a standard King room. It felt a tiny bit cramped. More importantly, it just didn't seem very pleasant. There was something missing in the quality of the decor. The bed was adequately comfortable after a night of dancing, but not overly so. For about $60 more per night, you can go to the hotel next door for a serious upgrade in room quality. The Magnolia presents itself as a boutique hotel, but I think it's in need of a little extra TLC to be truly deserving of the "boutique" designation. If you're looking to lounge around in luxury all day, I'd recommend going elsewhere. That said, if you just want a decent place to stay downtown without breaking the bank, the Magnolia should suit you. Side note: there were two weddings going on. It does seem like a nice place to hold a wedding, as it has a lovely reception area on the lower level, and the overall feel on this and the main floor is one of elegance.

src_texts: Great location for Pepsi Center ---SEP--- Wanted to find a hotel that would put us in close proximity to the Pepsi Center and restaurants. Springhill Suites hit the mark. It is across the street from the Pepsi Center and within walking distance to a variety of restaurants and shops. Since we only came up to Denver for a concert, it was a one night stay. Everyone we met was friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated. We arrived late to breakfast, but there was a good selection still available. Only surprise in our stay was the valet parking fee. Didn't remember reading that in the hotel info online, although I'm sure it was there. All in all it was a great stay. Will definitely choose Springhill Suites next time we need a place for a concert stay.
ref_texts: Dear dahdls, We greatly appreciate your time spent to share your feedback on your stay with us at SpringHill Suites Denver Downtown! Our proximity to the Pepsi Center and other attractions make us a convenient destination for many different travelers, including yourselves. We are working diligently to ensure our parking rates are not a surprise, regardless of the booking channel any guest should use to reserve a stay with us. We do keep our valet costs at the lower end for Downtown Denver rates, as parking is unfortunately competitive in this city due to lack of space. We have many green alternatives as well, with our shuttle service to Union Station making rides to the airport easier, as well as our close proximity to two different light rail stations. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again for your next concert visit! Regards, Erica Olenick - Hotel Manager

src_texts: Memorial Day Weekend 2015 ---SEP--- I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights over the 2015 Memorial Day weekend. I found the staff to helpful and always courteous. The location was very convenient for experiencing the downtown / speedway events, nightclubs, and restaurants. The parking expense at the Westin and the immediate area is absurd. The room view was a large air conditioning unit, but I wasn't in Indy to look out a hotel window. The room was clean and well kept and maintained, the bed was outstanding; we had a king size bed that was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Overall a very nice experience.
